description: Conversion of office space to two flats on the ground floor of a multi-family dwelling with a ground-floor rear extension and ground-floor side extension on existing rear and side extensions
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): DWG01 Location Plan Rev 1, DWG02 Site Plan Rev 1, DGW03 Rev 1 Existing Ground Floor Plan, DWG04 Rev 1 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, DWG05 Rev 1 Existing First Floor Plan, DWG06 Rev 1 Existing Second Floor Plan, DWG07 Rev 1 Existing and Proposed Section A-A, DWG08 Rev 1 Existing and Proposed Back Elevation, DWG09 Rev 1 Existing and Proposed Side Elevation, DWG10 Rev 1 Existing and Proposed Ground Floor Plan.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Cycle storage for three (3) bicycle spaces for the use of flats 7 and 8 shall be provided within the rear curtilage, as stated in drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2); within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front garden of the property, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5-10dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/e=ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, ie. Kitchen/dining and living rooms above/below bedroom of separate dwellings.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation for the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 of the Housing SPG 2014, Policy 7.15 of the London Plan. | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area, unless specified on drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
